query: Summarize the discussion about speech enhancement.

They also wanted to learn more about the effect of on-line normalization.

query: What was the conclusion of the paper?

The team also found that adding the endpoint information to the baseline improved the performance of the model by twenty-two percent. The main mismatch was coming from the amount of noise and the silence frames in the database.

query: What were the results of the experiments?

The goal was to find a feature that could improve the performance of the model. The team performed two experiments. One was to take the spectral subtraction from the spectrum of the signal and the output of the mel filter bank. The other was to train a neural network to select voice-unvoice-silence silence. The results of both experiments were not significant. The difference was due to the amount of noise and the silence frames.

Industrial Designer thought that they needed a screen with music because people would need to scroll to get to a specific song. Project Manager thought they would need a screen for the wheel because it just seemed like in order to have someone going around and using the wheel, it would be necessary to have the screen. User Interface thought they should have a menu option so that people could go back and forth and choose if they wanted to change the brightness of the television or turn on the timer or something.

query: Why was Industrial Designer against the idea of a screen?
summary: Industrial Designer thought that a screen was unnecessary because people would have to scroll to get channels, and it would be more expensive to have an advanced chip if they wanted to have a screen in the remote control, which was more expensive than the regular chip.

query: What's the conclusion of the discussion on the product evaluation?
summary: The team agreed that the fancy look and feel of the remote control went far beyond the functionality of the thing, and the ease of use was included in the ease. The product was technologically innovative in a way and the easy to use was trendy. The team also agreed on the material of the case and the shape of the device.

query: Summarize the discussion about the design of the remote control.
summary: The team decided to use a flip-top with a plastic shell and a different shape from what's normal. They would use rubber as a padding or for the grip, and they would incorporate the image of the company into the design. There would be a G-U-I interface in the middle of the remote control, which would be like a touch screen. The remote control would be made of plastic and rubber, and it would have a spongy feel. It would be in vegetable and fruit colours, and the team would take inspiration from the vibrant colours of fruit. The team would use a combination of rubber and plastic for the case, and rubber as the material for the rubber cover. The battery would be double A and triple A, and there would be no rechargeable batteries. The group would have to decide on the position of the buttons.

query: What did the group discuss about the function of kinetic charging?
summary: Industrial Designer explained that the kinetic battery was a smaller cell which it charged into and the size of a watch battery, so it would last for long time. Project Manager was not sure how long the battery would last but he had never seen one run out. The amount the user would be doing all the time would charge it up, so he didn't think you would ever need to actually physically start shaking it up to make it work.

query: Why did Industrial Designer disagree with the Project Manager when talking about kinetic charging when discussing the design?
summary: Industrial Designer thought that the kinetic charging was not necessary because the amount the user would be doing all the time would charge it up, so he didn't think you would ever need to actually physically start shaking it up to make it work. Also, he thought that it would detract from the attractiveness of the whole feature.

query: What was the conclusion of the discussion on the battery options?
summary: Industrial Designer first pointed out that double A and triple A batteries were a bit too bulky at the moment, while the kinetic ones came with a sort of watch-like battery that went in a watch, so it would be cheaper to re-manufacture them. Project Manager agreed that the kinetic one was a good idea, but he didn't think it was necessary for the remote control because most people had the light on in the room anyway so they could get when when you got TV.

query: What were the opinions of the group on the energy efficiency of the battery?
summary: Industrial Designer thought that double A and triple A batteries were the cheapest, but they were a bit too bulky at the moment. Project Manager thought that they were not very resistant to dropping, so they should be considered as a back-up. User Interface thought that the battery should be in standby mode for a short time, so that it would not run out over night.

query: Summarize the discussion about the implementation of the new product.
summary: The Industrial Designer had some initial ideas about some things which were nice to take with him in the upcoming discussion. For instance, one remote control should control a diverse subset of equipment, for instance, D-V-D players, cell phones, video and audio equipment. In addition, there should be some interoperabi interoperability between them. Also, infrared might be an issue because lots of devices already use infrared, so they would probably have to implement that. In terms of the battery life, it should not consume too much power because it would be annoying if users had to change the batteries every other week. Finally, the user interface should be visible in dark.

query: What did the group discuss about the interoperability of the remote control?
summary: Industrial Designer proposed that one remote control should control one or more pieces of equipment, for instance, D-V-D players, cell phones, video and audio equipment. However, infrared was not hot technical stuff anymore, so they should think about the way how these things should communicate with each other. User Interface suggested that they could equip infrared and Bluetooth together in one remote. This would be cost-effective, but not all TVs were equipped with infrared.

query: What was the conclusion of the discussion on the cost limitation of the product?
summary: Industrial Designer first pointed out that the financial part of this project implicates that it's not going to be a high high-end product because they want to develop a trendy product. Therefore, the cost of the product should not exceed 12 Euro fifty. Project Manager agreed.

query: Why did User Interface disagree with Industrial Designer when talking about the range?
summary: User Interface thought it was quite disturbing when you always had to point directly to the TV, so infrared should be restricted to that. For TV, the range should not be a problem because you're always in in the neighbourhood of a TV. For radio, if you want to get it working with a radio, and you're in outside your garden with just one speaker, then the range is very limited.

query: What were the opinions of the group when discussing the price?
summary: Industrial Designer thought the financial part of this project implicates that it was not going to be a high high-end product. Therefore, the cost price was very low. However, there was a cost limitation because they wanted to develop a trendy product.

query: How did Industrial Designer propose to make the product trendy?
summary: Industrial Designer proposed that the remote control should be able to work on different TVs or even different devices. In addition, the digits of the buttons should not fade and the digits should be visible in dark.
